ns:common.document.text: The MicroScript programming language is a graphically-oriented, high-level programming language similar to Apple Computer's HyperTalk. It was created by Personal Media Corporation for the TRON real-time operating system. It is intended mainly for end users with little or no programming experience, yet is also used as a development tool by professional BTRON programmers to port software between TRON variants, and to easily and quickly write device drivers for hardware devices. MicroScript is based on, and makes extensive use of, the TRON Basic Text Editor, and Basic Figure Editor.
